title: What is a good intermediate book for investment planning and analysis? - Quora

response.answer_text: The is a whole universe of investment out there - from stocks, bonds, options, commodities, property. So are you talking about this overview when you want to learn about investment planning and analysis? ie which assets to select, which investment style to select eg technical vs fundamental. Or are you more specific in learning about one particular investment class eg stock market? If you are talking about the stock market, there are 3 skills you need to develop how to analyze companieshow to value themhow to mitigate against risksI have not come across any book that covers all these 3. Because of this, I have curated a list of articles, podcasts, videos that is available free online and categorized them into 3 levels of expertise. Someone who is interested to learn about how to invest as a value investor can then pick the appropriate level to start. If you are thinking of this, then search “baby steps into the investment universe”

Not my cuppa, but that sounds more like “portfolio management” than it does “trading” or “investing”. If so then other search-engine seed phrases would include “efficient frontier” and “modern portfolio theory”. If I were to recommend any reading to the student, I would recommend tacking “wikipedia” on to the end of your selected search-engine seed, for an overview. Bottom line here, search engines respond well to specific ‘terms of art’, so that’s not a bad way to start to learn these days, cultivating an ‘ear’ for the ‘jargon’.
